title: MathBlock
description: A block of math, e.g an equation, to be treated as block content.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

mathLanguage.description: The language used for the equation e.g tex, mathml, asciimath.

min.description: Do not generate a math language.

low.description: Generate one of the math language names.

high.description: Generate a random string of up to 10 alphanumeric characters.

code.description: The code of the equation in the `mathLanguage`.

min.description: Generate a simple fixed string of math.

low.description: Generate a random string of up to 10 alphanumeric & space characters.

high.description:
Generate a random string of up to 100 characters, excluding those used as math
delimiters in Markdown.

compileDigest.$comment: Used to avoid unnecessary transpilation to MathML.

errors.description: Errors that occurred when parsing the math equation.
errors.$comment:
This property is an array of strings. Compare this to `CodeChunk.errors`
which is an array of `CodeError` nodes. Strings are considered to
be sufficient for math parsing errors which usually won't have stack traces,
line numbers etc.

mathml.$comment: Used along with `compileDigest` to avoid unnecessary transpilation to MathML.

label.description: A short label for the math block.
